technology.short_description: Performed correctly, this sequence will allow Nakai to add additional forces to his burgeoning horde, that the Wanderer's enemies may feel his might and tremble.
If its sacred plaque has been correctly interpreted, completion of this sequence will gift Nakai's horde with increased capacity, so larger forces may be fielded and his enemies be crushed.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: This sequence will increase the capacity of Nakai's rapidly-growing horde, meaning he can field a much larger force, making the prospect of facing this terrifying adversary all the more daunting.
Assuming the Skink Priests' interpretation of its sacred plaque was correct, greater numbers of Lizardmen warriors will become available, so that Nakai might repel the warm-blooded interlopers.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: This sequence, concerning battle tactics, will make even more Skinks, Saurus and the myriad forms of beastly reptiles available to Nakai's horde, that he might slay the enemies of the Lizardmen utterly.
If correctly performed, this sequence will mean Nakai's by-now mighty horde will be able to field an even greater, deadlier force than ever before – surely his enemies will crumble in its wake?
If the Skink Priests have carried out their duties to the letter, this sequence will increase the capacity for Nakai's horde to field armies even more, so he may defeat the hated warmblood foe.
According to the relevant plaque, this sequence will reduce the cost of successive spawnings of all types of Lizardmen warriors into Nakai's forces.
To the victors the spoils! This sequence guarantees that income gained from sacking and looting following a settlement battle will be increased significantly.
The venerated Old Ones, whose Great Plan Nakai and the Lizardmen are sworn to complete, bless their children and keep them pure in the face of insidious corruption from without.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all armies)
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%

Vigour loss reduction: -10% when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan empowers the Old Ones’ children to share their creators’ resilience against the age-old enemy.

effects.description:
Immune to Chaos corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Successfully completing this sequence will improve the chances of success of Nakai's Lizardmen Heroes' clandestine actions, whilst diminishing those of their foes.

technology.onscreen_name: Determining the Strength of the Old
technology.short_description: Even from their initial spawning, this sequence ensures that Nakai's new Lizardmen Lords will have improved leadership abilities from the very beginning, that they might force the warmbloods from Lustrian shores.
Like all races, there are disparate factions within Lizardmen society; completion of this sequence will help them find common ground and focus on freeing Lustria from the warmblood infestation.
This sequence, if completed as per the Old Ones' coded instructions, will mean that construction is swifter and cheaper for Nakai and his reptilian brethren.
No beings are more able to flourish and prosper within the ultra-humid jungles of Lustria than the Lizardmen; this sequence improves Nakai's ability to see danger and respond more quickly.
Correct interpretation is essential if the Great Plan is to be executed to the Old Ones' intended design.

ui_effects.localised_text: Magical unit that can cast spells
Spawned unit fights in this battle only

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees a greater number of braves gain the Old Ones’ approbation, making them harder to kill.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Heroes will be wounded instead

technology.short_description: There are many paths to order and knowledge; may the Old Ones guide us.

effects.description:
Leadership +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all armies)

Replenishes 15% campaign movement range after winning a battle
	(all characters)

Leadership +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: The steps inherent to completion of this sequence enable Nakai's hordes to spawn en masse and within a significantly shorter timeframe, enabling the Wanderer to meet growing threats head on.

effects.description: Increases the amount of Spawning Sequence earned by rites by: +25%

technology.short_description: The jungle itself is a predator; this sequence improves the hardiness of Nakai's hordes, so fewer of their number fall on campaign when not fighting battles.

effects.description: Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.short_description: Completion of this sequence ensures certain spawnings will be more experienced from birth and therefore require less training to be effective.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: Successful completion of this sequence will ensure those who guard the Lizardmen's temples to the Old Ones are better able to repel attackers from their sacred spaces.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Melee attack: +5 for Temple Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: This sequence increases the rate of growth of Nakai's horde, enabling the construction of more buildings and eventually swelling its population; soon, the warmbloods will flee afore them!
The monstrous beasts fielded by the Lizardmen are truly terrifying; correct completion of this sequence can only make them more so – as the Old Ones surely intended.

effects.description: Attribute: Strider for Cold Ones and Cold One Riders

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

technology.short_description: The most irregular weapons are reserved for Terradon Riders, who are armed with poison-tipped javelins, fireleech bolas, and various other unusual ordnances.

effects.description: Base missile damage: -4 for Terradon Rider units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +4 for Terradon Rider units

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees convalescent abilities become more prevalent within the horde; tails and limbs regrow as easily as scratches heal!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan grants boons unto the Kroxigor, augmenting their blood-curdling roars.

effects.description: Passive ability: Enhanced Spawn Kin for Kroxigor units (Replaces Spawn Kin)
Attribute: Causes Terror for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

technology.short_description: When war is a constant state, losses are guaranteed – whether through attrition or casualties on the battlefield; this sequence helps Nakai to replenish their numbers for the next fight.
Following these steps carefully will mean mounts recruited afterwards will be more experienced than their newly-spawned peers before a drop of blood has been spilled.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terradon Riders and Ripperdactyl Riders units
Charge bonus: +10 for Cold One units

technology.short_description: Once the foe's blood begins to flow the Cold Ones go into near-uncontrollable frenzy.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Cold One units
Weapon strength: +10% for Cold One units

technology.short_description: Completion of this sequence not only improves the growth rate of Nakai's hordes, it also keeps construction costs as low as possible, to aid their advance and free Lustria from foreign invaders.
Even without the experiential benefits of this sequence, the Saurus warrior-class are fearsome adversaries; completing it correctly will make them even more formidable in the field.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: The Saurus are already near-peerless warriors; this sequence, if completed carefully and to the letter, will increase their battlefield capabilities even further.

This sequence will increase Nakai's hordes' magical reserves and help to replenish their losses due to war and attrition, that they may continue their relentless slaying of the foe in service of the Great Plan.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: This sequence is used to produce the larger beasts used by the Lizardmen, but at higher experience levels than an ordinary spawning would produce.

effects.description: Removes Attribute "Wounds" from (Rank 7 and above) Dread Saurians
Recruit rank: +2 for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
Missile resistance: 15% for Bastiladon and Stegadon units

technology.short_description: Fresh quadruped 'recruits' are always required when war comes to Lustria's jungle shores.

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units

Attribute: Immune to Psychology for mounted characters
	(all characters)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: This sequence improves the base-level experience of freshly-spawned Skinks, improving their usefulness on the battlefield and increasing the likelihood of victory exponentially.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for all Skink and Chameleon Skink Infantry units
Passive ability: Enhanced Spawn Kin for Skink units (Replaces Spawn Kin)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

technology.short_description: As they are naturally the weaker sub-race of Lizardmen, the Skinks can be strengthened by completing this sequence correctly, increasing their worth on the battlefield exponentially.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units
Missile strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units

technology.short_description: Those horde-members wounded in battle against Nakai's foes will be replaced or recover from their injuries more quickly, assuming this sequence is completed correctly, of course.
The Lizardmen train the savage reptiles of the Lustrian jungles to slay their enemies in battle; completion of this sequence will ensure they are even more brutal and aggressive in the fray.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
Charge bonus: +15 for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units

technology.short_description: By submerging in the brackish swamps and prowling the labyrinthian undergrowth, even hulking predators can be taught stealth among the wetlands of Lustria.

effects.description: Attribute: Snipe for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

effects.description: Attribute: Stalk for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: Nakai's horde will inevitably suffer losses over the course of a campaign; completing this sequence will aid replenishment of its numbers whilst also bolstering its rate of growth.
When completed successfully, this sequence will replace Nakai's losses and reduce the cost of keeping his horde together and in peak fighting condition.
